org.miwarre.ap.gui

Class GuiTitleBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiElement
      • net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiPanel
        • org.miwarre.ap.gui.GuiTitleBar

  • public class GuiTitleBar
extends net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiPanel
    Implements the concept of a title bar common to many other classes of this package.

    A title bar is made of a title text and of an optional close button.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuiTitleBar

        public GuiTitleBar(net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiElement parent,
                   java.lang.String titleText,
                   boolean hasCancelButton)
        Creates a new title bar as a child of an existing GuiElement (typically a GuiPanel).

        The bar is added to the given parent, is given a specific background colour and pivot position (TopLeft); its title text is given a specific font colour and size.

        If the close button is required, the image element for it is also created.

        Parameters:
        parent - the GuiElement to which to add the title bar
        titleText - the text of the title
        hasCancelButton - whether the title bar should have a cancel button or not.

    • Method Detail

      • isCancelButton

        public boolean isCancelButton(net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiElement element)
        Checks if the given element is the cancel button or not.
        Parameters:
        element - the GuiElement to check.
        Returns:
        true if the passed GuiElement is the title bar cancel button, false if it is not.

      • getTitleText

        protected java.lang.String getTitleText()
        Returns the current title text.
        Returns:
        the current title text as a String.

      • free

        protected void free()
        Releases all the resources used by the title bar. To be used before disposing of the title bar itself.

        After calling this method, the title bar cannot be used any longer.

      • getMinWidth

        public int getMinWidth()
        Returns a minimal width (in pixels) suitable to contain the whole title bar.
        Returns:
        a minimal width in pixels.

      • relayout

        public void relayout()
        Updates the width and the position of the title bar to match the current width and height of the parent GuiElement.

        To be used after the parent GuiElement has reached its definitive width and height, typically right before displaying the parent to a player.

        The title bar is placed at the top of the parent and inset a few pixels from the parent left, top and right border.

      • show

        public void show(net.risingworld.api.objects.Player player)
        Displays the title bar on the screen of a player.

        To be used instead of player.addGuiElement(titleBar), as this method manages the addition of all the elements making the bar up at once.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to show this title bar to.

      • hide

        public void hide(net.risingworld.api.objects.Player player)
        Removes the title bar from the screen of a player.

        To be used instead of player.removeGuiElement(titleBar), as this method removes all the elements making the bar up at once.

        Parameters:
        player - the player to remove this title bar from.
